com.foreach.across.core.registry

Class RefreshableRegistry<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.core.registry.RefreshableRegistry<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<T>, Collection<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IncrementalRefreshableRegistry

    @Refreshable
public class RefreshableRegistry<T>
extends Object
implements Collection<T>

    The RefreshableRegistry is a simple bean holding a collection of instances and provides more flexibility than autowiring a list of instances directly. Depending on the includeModuleInternals only members visible in the containing module will be selected (false, default) or all members from all modules (true). The RefreshableRegistry updates its member list after the AcrossContext has bootstrapped.

    Members will be returned in the following order:

    • implementing Ordered or Order
    • based on bootstrap index of the module that provides the member
    • implementing OrderedInModule or OrderInModule
    • any manually added members that were not picked up by the context scan

    Note that a RefreshableRegistry behaves as a set: duplicate members will be ignored.

    See Also:
    IncrementalRefreshableRegistry, Ordered, PriorityOrdered, OrderComparator

    • Method Detail

      • refresh

        @PostConstruct
@PostRefresh
public void refresh()
        Will cause the registry to refresh its members from the AcrossContext. Also called automatically after the containing module has bootstrapped and after the entire AcrossContext has bootstrapped.

      • add

        public boolean add(T member)
        Manually add a member to the registry. If the same member is already present, it will be ignored. Manually added members will never be removed by a refresh.
        Specified by:
        add in interface Collection<T>
        Parameters:
        member - Member instance to add.

        Specified by:

      • remove

        public boolean remove(Object member)
        Removes a member from the registry. If the member was not added manually it is possible it will be added again if a call to refresh() is done.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Collection<T>
        Parameters:
        member - Member instance to remove.

      • getFixedMembers

        public Collection<T> getFixedMembers()
        Returns:
        All manually added members of the registry.

        public Collection<T> getMembers()
        Returns:
